quotes.text: Your entities can be very complex, but they're still entities. You have to use the right name.
quotes.author: Gien Verschatse

quotes.text: Aggregates are about consistency and concurrency. You need invariance for aggregates.
quotes.author: Gien Verschatse

quotes.text: We don't want to jump on any complex entity and think it's an aggregate; that's one of the common mistakes.
quotes.author: Thomas Coopman

quotes.text: Bounded Context is about an explicit boundary so we can choose what is in and what is out. Within the boundary we want a consistent model and language.
quotes.author: Gien Verschatse

quotes.text: A draft specification is a pattern within a bounded context regarding consistency. We don't have to anny the user with validation every time.
quotes.author: Gien Verschatse

quotes.text: We need aggregates in order to keep invariants. If you don't have invariants, you don't really need an aggregate.
quotes.author: Thomas Coopman
